message: this is not underrated

Tiny plothole, Lena has seen Shin's headless knight logo before, when she met Shourei when she was younger, and she clearly remembers it too (or at least up until last season) because she was asking Shin if he knows of the headless knight mark. She should have at least some reaction to seeing the mark. (S1E4, at the very end)

Actually Shin's logo is not a Knight but the Undertaker with a shovel. Shourei's Logo is headless because its Dullahan and it has is red cape and a sword in it. I dont remember Shin telling her what his logo look like. She wouldnt expect his Undertaker logo would also be a skeleton and a headless like a Dullahan.

i dont think she could see it cuz it was on the side of the reigenleif while she was standing on the front of the reigen leif(not to mention the mark was on the lifted gun part or smtn) and shiden didn't expand the coversation on the mark cuz she assumed that lena had never seen the mark hence she focused on giad republic flag more i guess

Cyclops and Lena's viewing angle were roughly the same, and the narrative of the show sweeps it under the rug as "she's never seen it so we don't have to build on it right now." If they wanted to make sure Lena couldnt see it, they wouldve made it a point to do so.

I can see your point but there are a lot of factors which could have been at play here , mere coincidence being one of them and maybe also because lena was more focused on the giadian helicopters which were flying . also shiden was a bit more on the right side of the reiginleif than lena (from lena and shiden's pov)was and that could have made a difference

This episode is one of the most finely made episode I've seen till date.
It represents the thorough nature of Shin pointing out his inner feelings and what he's the most scared of, loneliness, being left behind. He's fragile yet a tough soldier who continuously carried the burdens of his comrades...
Also the VA of Shin did a fabulous job!..
The Whole Season felt like it was made for Shin. Though Lena didn't got much screentime , she showed up at the right moment reminding Shin about himself.
